main.name: Aleksa Mitic
main.occupation: Freelance Web developer  && English Teacher at iTutor
main.bio: Since being introduced to programming by a close friend I have read through as much material one can possibly go through,took a good amount of Udemy courses, and also enrolled into a government backed course classes at Faculty Of Electronic Engineering in Nis as a part of Junior Developer program. From the moment I created Hello World in the console of my first application, I knew I was hooked onto software development. But software development has never been just a job for me, it's offered an engaging challenge to continually learn and improve my skills in creating high-quality software. What started with a simple Hello World has become a full-fledged passion that only gets more exciting as time goes by.

resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

education.description: The main goal of the study program of the master's academic studies in Production and Information Technology is to acquire knowledge that is competent to cover the needs in the industry for work on jobs that simultaneously require the application of mechanical engineering and informatics. This knowledge includes the integration of the application of computers and modern software packages, sensors and actuators, analog and digital control systems and their implementation in production systems.

The field of study, Engineering Management, is exceptional in that it lies at the interface between engineering and business, it contains elements of both as well as subjects unique to its own area of study. In practice, it combines the engineerâ€™s technical problem-solving ability with business acumen and skills.

Government backed course classes at Faculty Of Electronic Engineering in Nis as a part of Junior Developer program. The program contained five modules, first one was solving algorithmic problems where I was introduced for the first time with basic programming concepts and creating simple console applications. The next module was introduction to advanced C# and Object-oriented programming paradigm, where I created a small application using Objects, Classes. Inheritance, Abstraction, and Polymorphism. The third module I liked the most, I was here introduced to JS and I simply fall in love with it. We created a simple website using HTML, CSS, JS, and also AJAX after that we converted it to the ASP.NET MVC framework. Forth module was a database, I learned here almost everything about SQL from how to create relations to writing complicated queries. In the last module, I was introduced to agile methodology, I learned about SCRUM, Kanban, and lean methodology.
